channel.title: Playing on Low Detail
channel.description:
Hey mopars,
This is a question about 317 Client
does somone know where into the files you can make it so its only possibel to play on it on low detail becaus when i play on moparscape with the server it goes low detail but on my own webclient i always go in high detail end that bring a small lag.
All suggestions are welcome i am willing to try everything.
Thx for reading end hope you can help me
Supra ~ (TimeToDie @ www.freewebs.com/funstad)

item.title: Playing on Low Detail
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

Yes, in the main method is where they are called.
And they are also declared in the client class.

Read full topic

item.title: Playing on Low Detail
item.dc:creator: @supra_s supra s
item.description:
@supra_s wrote:

[quote=“x blitz x, post:4, topic:234108”]Well, i have a refracted client. and this is the method

    private static void setLowMem()
    {
        WorldController.lowMem = true;
        Texture.lowMem = true;
        lowMem = true;
        ObjectManager.lowMem = true;
        ObjectDef.lowMem = true;
    }
    private static void setHighMem()
    {
        WorldController.lowMem = false;
        Texture.lowMem = false;
        lowMem = false;
        ObjectManager.lowMem = false;
        ObjectDef.lowMem = false;
    }

I’m not sure if it will help.[/quote]

could help where is that located ? client.java?

Read full topic

item.title: Playing on Low Detail
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

Well, i have a refracted client. and this is the method

    private static void setLowMem()
    {
        WorldController.lowMem = true;
        Texture.lowMem = true;
        lowMem = true;
        ObjectManager.lowMem = true;
        ObjectDef.lowMem = true;
    }
    private static void setHighMem()
    {
        WorldController.lowMem = false;
        Texture.lowMem = false;
        lowMem = false;
        ObjectManager.lowMem = false;
        ObjectDef.lowMem = false;
    }

I’m not sure if it will help.

Read full topic

item.title: Playing on Low Detail
item.dc:creator: @supra_s supra s
item.description:
@supra_s wrote:

[quote=“Rog3r, post:2, topic:234108”]It only brings lag to your end.

I don’t think you could convert a high detail client?
Never heard anything of that, but if there is a way - I guess i’m no help.

My suggestion is to get a new client perhaps, but most are in high detail?

If you don’t want to do that, you might just have to live with the lag.
It won’t cause lag to anyone else but you.[/quote]

there is a way its just a simple code line but i realy cant find it like
high detail = True; end i just need to change it to high detail = fals;

but there are so many files

Read full topic

item.title: Playing on Low Detail
item.dc:creator: @Rog3r Rog3r
item.description:
@Rog3r wrote:

It only brings lag to your end.

I don’t think you could convert a high detail client?
Never heard anything of that, but if there is a way - I guess i’m no help.

My suggestion is to get a new client perhaps, but most are in high detail?

If you don’t want to do that, you might just have to live with the lag.
It won’t cause lag to anyone else but you.

Read full topic
